pullRequest.title: Issue #6707: fix false violation report that does not allow spaces in front of ellipsis tokens for Google Style
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issue #6707: fix false violation report that does not allow spaces in front of ellipsis tokens for Google Style, specific information are in issue.
diff report:
https://huganghui.github.io/6707-ellipsis/diff/

nodes.bodyText:
we do not need to remove token from Check and will break a lot in this world.
If Google style do not need this token, ti should be removed from Google config.

nodes.bodyText: please add to google style IT Inputs bunch of code with all possible combinations of ... and annotations.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -49,7 +49,6 @@ public void testDefault() throws Exception {
             "266:1: " + getCheckMessage(MSG_KEY, ";"),
             "270:16: " + getCheckMessage(MSG_KEY, ";"),
             "284:1: " + getCheckMessage(MSG_KEY, ";"),
-            "287:62: " + getCheckMessage(MSG_KEY, "..."),

nodes.bodyText: please update default NoWhitespaceBefore to have no ELLIPSIS in tokens list.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -709,6 +709,9 @@
       <property name="tokens" value="METHOD_REF"/>
     </module>
     <module name="NoWhitespaceBefore"/>
+    <module name="NoWhitespaceBefore">
+      <property name="tokens" value="ELLIPSIS"/>
+    </module>

nodes.bodyText:
I think this checkConfig is not proper for google style, but I do not find a way to add attribute to config like 
  
    
      checkstyle/src/test/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/whitespace/NoWhitespaceBeforeCheckTest.java
    
    
         Line 76
      in
      11bb48a
    
    
    
    

        
          
           checkConfig.addAttribute("tokens", "DOT");
please move this token to config instance above, no need to have two instances.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -708,7 +708,16 @@
       <property name="tokens" value="INDEX_OP"/>
       <property name="tokens" value="METHOD_REF"/>
     </module>
-    <module name="NoWhitespaceBefore"/>
+    <module name="NoWhitespaceBefore">
+      <property name="tokens" value="COMMA"/>
+      <property name="tokens" value="SEMI"/>
+      <property name="tokens" value="POST_INC"/>
+      <property name="tokens" value="POST_DEC"/>
+      <property name="tokens" value="LABELED_STAT"/>
+    </module>
+    <module name="NoWhitespaceBefore">
+      <property name="tokens" value="ELLIPSIS"/>

nodes.bodyText:
you do not need to update Test to add attribute, if you need such token - add it to google_checks.xml file.
Such tests do validation of google config as is, without any modification.
Such tests are not tests for Check, they are tests for exact config.
In issue I provided several usecases, please use them all and be creative and do even more, the weirder code the better.

nodes.bodyText: lowercase b in Between and please add the rule number that specifies where google allows it. I assume this is 4.6.2 point 9?

@romani I am not seeing where it is saying this expected/allowed.
https://checkstyle.org/styleguides/google-java-style-20180523/javaguide.html#s4.6.2-horizontal-whitespace

a single ASCII space also appears in the following places only.
Between a type annotation and [] or ....

There is no type annotation here and guide specifically says space is ONLY allowed where google defined it. There is no type annotation here, so there should be a violation.
#6707 (comment)

there is no item for space between type and [], so It is ok to demand no space before ....

It seems we are in agreement then? Nothing I see says this will be fixed later.
I am expecting changes to the logic of the check to look for annotation or not as specified in #6707 (comment)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,44 @@
+package com.google.checkstyle.test.chapter4formatting.rule462horizontalwhitespace;
+
+import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
+import java.lang.annotation.Target;
+
+@Target(ElementType.TYPE_USE)
+@interface NonNull {
+
+}
+
+public class InputNoWhitespaceBeforeAnnotations {
+
+    public void foo(final char @NonNull [] param) {} // ok
+
+    @NonNull int @NonNull[] @NonNull[] fiel1; // OK until #8205
+    @NonNull int @NonNull [] @NonNull [] field2; // ok
+    //@NonNull int @NonNull ... field3; // non-compilable
+    //@NonNull int @NonNull... field4; // non-compilable
+
+
+    public void foo1(final char[] param) { // OK until #8205
+    }
+
+    public void foo2(final char [] param) { // ok
+    }
+
+    public void foo3(final char @NonNull[] param) { // OK until #8205
+    }
+
+    public void foo4(final char @NonNull [] param) { // ok
+    }
+
+    void test1(String... param) { // OK until #8205
+    }
+
+    void test2(String ... param) { // ok
